Borders Employment Opportunities
The Borders online application may provide the bookstore job of your dreams. Begin an entry-level job or full-time career with the pay and job benefits you desire. Fill out an online job application form to begin the Borders hiring process now.
Borders needs to hire motivated and knowledgeable individuals to fill positions in locations across the nation. Full-time and part-time job opportunities provide applicants 18 and over with a wide array of employment opportunities. Borders jobs feature outstanding pay scales, flexible work schedules, and paid training opportunities in a fun and enjoyable work environment. Apply online with Borders to discover more information on job openings now.
Hiring both entry-level job seekers and career-minded candidates, Borders needs to hire sales associates, stock associates, booksellers, baristas, café workers, and cashiers now. Management opportunities and corporate careers also need staffed at Borders. Upper-level positions require applicants to earn additional training and certification before receiving employment consideration. Apply online to discover positions fitting your skill and experience level.
Apply online with the Borders employment application form to begin a career in the bookstore industry. Borders jobs feature outstanding base pay and quality job benefits. Submit your Borders online job application form to receive immediate hiring consideration.
Is Borders hiring for the holidays?
Available Borders Positions and Salary Options Always hiring, Boarders needs entry-level workers and professional associates to fill a number of in-store job titles. Both part-time jobs and full-time careers need staffed in locations nationwide. Applicants 18 and older may apply online to learn more about Borders job openings. Borders needs to staff the following jobs:
Bookseller – Booksellers provide product information, maintain a clean environment, and assist customers. Typical pay scales for booksellers range anywhere from $7 to $10 an hour, depending on experience, job title, and location.
Cashier – Cashiers greet customers, ring up purchases, sign up members for rewards cards, and handle returns. Borders must hire positive, helpful, and energetic individuals to staff cashier jobs. All cashiers start near minimum wage.
Café Server – Café workers, or baristas, take orders, make specialty coffee drinks and smoothies, and provide excellent customer service. Average starting pay for café servers starts near minimum wage.
Management – Career-minded applicants 18 and over seeking full-time jobs should apply online to find available Borders management roles. Borders managers oversee operations, hire and train new associates, drive sales, oversee inventory management, ensure store cleanliness meets company standards, and guarantee customer satisfaction. Sales managers receive salary options between $30,000 and $55,000 per year. General managers make upwards of $85,000 a year.
Borders provides many other entry-level job titles and full-time professional careers. Additional in-store Borders jobs include sales associate and loss prevention specialist positions. Borders also offers career in various shipping and distribution centers. The company must hire warehouse workers, IT technicians, maintenance technicians, shipping specialists, and forklift operators. Borders must hire career professionals to staff full-time corporate positions in HR, marketing, finance, merchandising, store operations, and information technology. Apply online to find more Borders career opportunities.
Borders Job Benefits Employees come first at Borders. The company rewards associates with good pay and outstanding employment benefits . Part-time associates receive competitive base pay, and full-time workers enjoy generous salary options. Outside of pay, Borders offers a host of job benefits to qualified workers. The company provides employee benefits for health and wellness, future savings, and personal development.
Qualified Borders employees receive numerous healthcare options. Eligible associates may receive medical, dental, and vision plans, along with flexible account spending, basic health insurance, and short and long-term disability coverage. The company also offers a 401(k) retirement plan, paid time off, employee discounts, and numerous employee development programs.
Read more about Borders benefits .

History Brothers Tom and Louis Borders opened the first location in 1971 in Ann Arbor, MI. Then called Borders Book Shop, the company operated an 800-square-foot used book shop. In the following years, Borders expanded operations and opened new locations in different markets. In 1992, Kmart acquired the company. Kmart change the name to Borders Group when taking the company public. In 2001, Borders partnered with Amazon to provide customers online shopping for a vast array of books and DVDs. Borders launched an eCommerce site in 2008. In 2010, the retailer launched an eBookstore on the Borders website.
Special Services Borders operates a chain of stores selling books, music, movies, and other media. Providing a wide selection of reading materials, Border offers over 190,000 titles. Borders provides a warm, relaxing atmosphere allowing customers to explore and discover new books. Many locations include coffee shops for customers to enjoy a relaxing drink while reading. The company also offers free wifi in every location.
Community Involvement Dedicated to improving the community, Borders supports numerous national non-profit organizations. The company works with charitable organizations to help promote literacy, education, and fine arts programs. Borders works in partnership with Gifts in Kind International, a national product donating charity, to provide books for hospitalized children. The company also supports national book drives and book festivals. In addition to helping national organizations, Borders also supports local charities. The company raises money for local charities though benefit days, volunteer gift-wrapping, and special events. In addition, Borders also operates an in-house charity, the Borders Group Foundation. A non-profit charitable organization, Borders Group Foundation helps support Borders employees and families. The foundation offers scholarships, bereavement outreach, and military support.
Environmental To help cut down on paper usage, Borders began selling e-books in 2010. In addition, the company constantly works to cut down waste and increase efficiency. Borders actively participates in numerous environmental sustainability and recycling programs, and the bookstore works to educate employees and customers about conservation.
International In 1997, Borders opened the first international store in Singapore. In the following years, the company opened more than 40 other stores throughout Puerto Rico, England, Ireland, Australia, and New Zealand. The company also opened several franchised locations in Malaysia and the United Arab Emirates. A growing company, Borders plans to continue expansion to new international markets.
Financial A public company, Borders Group trades on the New York Stock exchange under the ticker BGP. The company operates over 500 superstores, 175 mall-based locations, and 29 airport shops. A leader in the bookstore industry, Borders Group earns an average $2 billion in sales each year. The company maintains headquarters in Ann Arbor, MI, and employs thousands of workers nationwide.
